Subject: Klacht inzake BK - DV - Pommes Duchesse - zak 750g (inhoud 2022) -  (Kenmerk: 202405575-06) #ID-1bm1JhLb
TextBody: Goedemiddag, Het spijt ons te vernemen dat uw consument niet helemaal tevreden was over een artikel dat door Agristo wordt geproduceerd. Wij hechten immers het grootste belang aan de kwaliteit van onze producten en verpakkingen. Wij hebben deze melding in ons systeem geregistreerd onder case 28957. Op basis van de foto die u ons heeft bezorgd, kan ik u de vermoeden van de consument bevestigen waarbij het product niet correct is bewaard en de koude keten ergens is verbroken. Doordat het product is ontdooit geweest en opnieuw is ingevroren kan de aardappel een andere kleur aannemen, zoals we ook op foto zien. Het is moeilijk te achterhalen waar de koude keten onderbroken geweest is. We hebben ook geen soortgelijke meldingen ontvangen. Daarom zijn wij ervan overtuigd dat dit een geïsoleerd incident is en dat deze klacht niet wijdverspreid is. Wij excuseren ons voor het ongemak en blijven tot uw beschikking voor verdere informatie. Met vriendelijke groet, Evelien Cremers Evelien Technical Sales Officer Agristo nv P +32 56 54 09 44 --------------- Original Message ---------------

Subject: Klacht inzake BK - DV - Aardappelpartjes - zak 750g (inhoud 2023) -  (Kenmerk: 202405545-06) #ID-QKP2QTQb
TextBody: Beste, Bedankt dat u deze kwestie onder onze aandacht heeft gebracht. We hebben deze opmerking onmiddellijk in ons systeem geregistreerd onder case nummer 28944. Het spijt ons te horen dat uw klant niet tevreden was over de kwaliteit van deze batch. De kwaliteit van onze producten is voor ons van het allergrootste belang en wij doen er alles aan om deze kwestie op te lossen. Batchinformatie: Lotcode: G22 24 054 10:19 Productiedag : 23/02/2024 Na verder onderzoek is gebleken dat er tijdens de productie van deze batch enkele problemen waren met het watersnijmes. Tijdens de productie wordt de aardappel door middel van een waterstroom door het watersnijmes geduwd en zo in partjes gesneden: Uit het logboek van productie blijkt echter dat er wat problemen met de watersnijmessen waren, waardoor de messen moesten vervangingen worden. Wij vermoeden dat er tijdens een interventie een kleine aardappel mee in de goede productieflow geraakt, waardoor deze in de zak is terecht gekomen. Wij zijn er echter van overtuigd dat dit een beperkt aantal zakken zijn die geïnfecteerd kunnen zijn en wensen ons hiervoor te excuseren. Steeds tot uw beschikking voor verdere informatie, Met vriendelijke groeten, Cremers Evelien Technical Sales Officer Agristo nv P +32 56 54 09 44 --------------- Original Message ---------------

Subject: FW: Golden green tape chips.
TextBody: Dear, We have well received your below notification. First of all, I wish to explain the difference between the 2 products. Although at first glance, the Green Tape (coated salted product) may look quite similar to the White Tape (batter product), there Is a clear difference. You will notice the ingredient declaration is completely different as for the White product we are using Batter, which ensures product to remain very crispy for a longer period of time. Consumer experience may be different as a result. By this, of course, we do not mean that one product is better than the other, both are produced to high predefined standards. Getting back to the reason for your complaint, I noticed your complaint is related to 2 different lotcodes/batches: LOT C01 24 131 0959 Production day: 10th May LOT C05 24 035 0416 Production day: 4th February For the batch which has been produced beginning of May, it may occur that some darken faster, which could be explained to the increased presence of natural sugars at the end of the potato season. Having checked the QC records of this particular batch, I did notice an increase of sugar points, which were still within specification. Concerning the batch which has been produced on the 4th of February, I noticed your complaint is linked to the start-up of the production run. In the QC records it is shown that in the beginning we were indeed against the upper limit concerning sugar points, as a result of which production parameters were adjusted. On a subsequent check, we see the number of sugar points visibly decreasing and this remains throughout the rest of the run. Based on the above investigation and after checking with internally, we can grant you a credit note for the amount of 9 outer cases. Our apologies for the inconveniences. Hope this info serves you well,

Subject: [Request for confirmation] Claim Report 396716　[597:Agristo(ヘ゛ルキ゛ー)]◆
TextBody: Dear Pieter Lapierre san, Thank you for your reply. I have the following additional questions. Is the size of the perforation 2 cm? According to your documents, the problematic quantity this time seems to be 2,800 cartons. Is it possible to narrow down the scope of the problem even a little? We may have to sort them out here. Also, after discussing this with the packaging manager, please let us know what new measures you plan to take in the future. Yuga From: Agristo Claims <claims@agristo.com> Sent: Thursday, May 30, 2024 10:21 PM To: quality-improvement(kobebussan) <quality-improvement@kobebussan.co.jp> Cc: Neviani Ilaria(kobebussan) <neviani@kobebussan.co.jp>; Atsushi Karita(kobebussan) <karita@kobebussan.co.jp>; Noriyoshi Miki(kobebussan) <miki@kobebussan.co.jp>; Kenji Inada(kobebussan) <k.inada@kobebussan.co.jp>; Makoto Nakahara(kobebussan) <nakahara@kobebussan.co.jp>; line.cabbeke@agristo.com; Takuya Sakai(kobebussan) <sakai@kobebussan.co.jp> Subject: RE: [Request for confirmation] Claim Report 396716 [597:Agristo(ヘ゛ルキ゛ー)]◆ Dear Yuga san, Enclosed you can find an overview of the goods that have been produced, including the batch code, expiry date, order number and invoice number. As this was evident on the pictures you kindly shared, we are sure that this kind of perforation has been used on packing line D05. As you can see on the overview, however, 3 pallets were also packed on packing line D07 on this day. Unfortunately, as we do not have reference samples from this packing line, we can't tell if this kind of perforation has been used on this packing line D07 as well or not. Once again our sincere apologies for this. I have escalated this matter internally. If you need any further information, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Subject: Report of Difference Item -  INV: 90591509
TextBody: Dear Pieter I hope this email finds you well. Thank you for your reply. We shared the info with the custom brokers, and they checked the documents. Here below you may find some questions from them: 1) The production flow chart has AT1 and AT2. Which process do you follow for this item? AT1 or AT2? 2) By “salt bath” what do you mean? What kind of process is it? Also, is there any remaining salt (residue) in the final product? 3) In the last page of the flowchart, there is “fat application”. How do you apply fat? Is the palm oil indicated at this point, the one that you indicated in the ingredients (palm oil 2.7%)? 4) Are the other fat/oil used in this item? Thank you for your support. Looking forward to your reply.

Subject: Iceland Customer Product Complaint 03261201
TextBody: Dear, we've well received the foreign body. Please find below our investigation. Product Name: MCY 700G POT SHA GRILLED STK Product Codes: PLU 87633 Best Before or Use By date: 08 Dec 2024 Batch Code/Lot code: D06 22 346 08:24 Summary of complaint: 6 cm piece of hard blue plastic Supplier Comments How many packs were produced? 2340 CAR - 37440 units Line number Packaging line 6 Date of production D06 22 346 08:24 Daycode 346 = 12 december 2022 packaging order 1303702904 ICE BCSLG ,70 1 L60 (311566) van 12/12/2022 en 13/12/2022 Were any issues or non-conformances recorded for this production; including foreign body controls and monitoring equipment? Originating from 2 production orders: 1301029373 BLK BDCRSAUL 1 SUN T FGS (311602) from 11/2022 1301029445 BLK BDCRSAUL 1 SUN T FGS (311602) from 11/2022 1 foreign body message during run: no similarities with particle found by customer. Particle was removed from product flow + installation in NZ was checked, no deviations were noted. No other comments in Patapp, no NCP's created. Please outline the controls in place to prevent foreign material entering products -inspections of chip sites Our production chip line is equipped with multiple sophisticated installations to remove foreign objects from the production line, such as: Stone remover Washer Hedghoge conveyor Salt baht Different optical sorters -visual inspection when tilting fries in the gratin mixer. Have you reviewed retained samples / taste panel records - any deviation to specification? no Are complaints recorded and monitored for Trending purposes? yes How are complaints communicated to Staff / Senior Team? KPI consultation moments + memo Could the root cause be identified? No Outline Corrective Actions - Provide copies as attachment to support investigation of any relevant records (as below- not limited too) Glass & Plastic Checks Production Records Foreign body detection checks (Metal detector, X-Ray, Filters, optical sorts) QC Checks Taste Panel /Retained Samples External Independent Laboratory Analysis Report – Iceland requirement for ALL glass complaints Our investigation when we received the piece: Particle received and viewed with production manager: appears to match the color of the blue plasic palettes used in our factory. The structure is previously ribbed, but lifting the pallets with the forks of the forklift could possibly cause burrs to come loose and give them a ribbed appearance. How can this get to the product? To season the product, octabins with unseasoned product are coming in from the other production cites. These are tipped into our mixing plant. During tilting, the pallet is also tilted. The chance is rather small, but not non-existent, that a loose piece of the pallet has ended up in the product flow. We believe their is no food safety risk as the piece was in the bag and not in the product. The piece had a bleu color so it's visible to the consumer. At your disposal for further questions.

Subject: Melding PLUS Consumentenservice - 240526-000042 - Friet met schil bevatte 2 stukken aardappelsmurrie
TextBody: Beste lezer, Op het verzoek van PLUS Consumentenservice met referentienummer 240526-000042 heeft u zojuist de volgende reactie verstuurd: 3/6/2024 08:29 - Evelien Cremers Beste, Wij mochten onderstaande consumentenklacht met betrekking tot een vreemd voorwerp dat werd gevonden in de Plus Friet met schil in goede orde ontvangen. Het spijt ons te vernemen dat uw consument een negatieve ervaring had met een door Agristo geproduceerd artikel. Wij hechten immers het grootste belang aan de kwaliteit van onze producten en verpakkingen. Wij hebben deze melding in ons systeem geregistreerd onder ref. 28528. Aan de hand van de lotcode (G322327510:58) en de vervaldatum (01/10/2025) hebben wij kunnen achterhalen dat dit een productie betreft van 02/10/2023. We hebben de productiebladen en de kwaliteitscontroles van deze batch gecontroleerd – er werden geen anomalieën genoteerd. De volledige productie was conform. Het productieproces bevat veel fysieke en optische eliminatiestappen voor vreemde voorwerpen. Agristo probeert ook te investeren in alle nieuwe best practice technische oplossingen om vreemde voorwerpen te vermijden. Op basis van de foto's kunnen wij u bevestigen dat dit gaat om 2 stukjes opgehoopte afgebakken coating die vanuit de bakoven zijn losgekomen. De ovens worden op regelmatige gecontroleerd en gekuist zodoende deze stukken niet in de zak belanden. Daarnaast beschikken wij oven verschillende sorteert bedden die in normale omstandigheden deze stukken zouden moeten uitsorteren. Het ziet er naar uit dat ondanks onze harde inspanning er toch een stuk door de mazen van het net zijn gegaan. Waarvoor onze excuses. Mocht u nog vragen hebben dan horen wij het graag. Met vriendelijke groet, Evelien Cremers Uw antwoord zal, indien van toepassing, door PLUS Consumentenservice worden gebruikt om een antwoord richting de klant te formuleren. Mocht u nog vragen of opmerkingen hebben, neem dan gerust contact op met ons via 0800-222 44 43. Met vriendelijke groet, PLUS Consumentenservice

Subject: EMART TR - customer complaint about foreign material from Hashbrown
TextBody: Hi Christine, You can send the piece to our plant Agristo Nazareth ( Venecoweg 12, 9810 Nazareth) to the attention of Inez Aerts. Please mention also the case number: 26820. Thank you in advance.

Subject: EMART TR - customer complaint about foreign material from Hashbrown
TextBody: Hi Christine, Our quality team had a look to the report. Unfortunately they can not tell what it would be and where it comes from. Possible it could be a burned/charred leftover with some salt of the premix we use for this product. In the report they also describes the piece as a charred substance due to heat/combustion and that the object is considered harmless and is likely to have entered the product unintentionally during the production process. Will you still send the pieces to us? Hope you can work with this information towards your costumer.

Subject: PPF OUEST:  URGENT - Anomalie produits - AGRISTO
TextBody: Bonjour, Nous avons bien reçu votre e-mail et l'avons enregistré sous le numéro de dossier 28500. En pièce jointe, vous trouverez le CMR et la liste de colisage de cet envoi. Les marchandises ont été produites sur notre site de production à Nazareth, puis envoyées à notre site de Wielsbeke, d'où elles sont parties vers chez vous. La température de nos produits lors du chargement est un point d'attention (CCP) basé sur notre analyse des risques. C'est pourquoi nous contrôlons la température à chaque chargement en insérant un thermomètre à sonde entre les boîtes d'une palette. Pour le chargement depuis Wielsbeke vers Pomona, une température de -19°C a été enregistrée (voir capture d'écran). Pour votre information : le signe moins ne fonctionne pas dans SAP, c'est pourquoi il est indiqué '19'. [Inline image URL : data:image/png;base64,

Subject: PPF OUEST:  URGENT - Anomalie produits - AGRISTO
TextBody: Goeiemorgen, Wij kregen een klacht over temperatuur van een zending voor pomona, paklijst en CMR in bijlage. Producten werden geproduceerd in NZ ( zie mail hieronder, temperatuurregistraties werden al gecontroleerd), maar producten werden verladen vanuit Wielsbeke. Hebben jullie onregelmatigheden opgemerkt bij deze verlading op gebied van temperatuur ? Subject: RE: [Ticket: 124753] Claim:503
TextBody: Dear Mya san, In reply to question number 1 and 2: I checked internally, but we cannot give any more details about the settings (values) of the optical sorter. First of all, this is business sensitive information which is not shared with third parties. Secondly, we don't see any added value in sharing these numbers. Unless somebody has extensive knowledge about these machines, the numbers won't say anything. Thirdly, these figures are not relevant to this complaint as this does not change whether there may be product clumps in the product or not. (The settings are only adjusted for defects, not for product clumps.) In reply to question number 3: As you know, every hour, a bag is taken from the packing line to check the quality we are producing. Our QC team does a number of quality checks (such as length, defects, temperature, smell, taste, etc.). Based on the results of the quality checks that have been carried out on defects, the team can decide to set the settings of the optical sorter "stricter". If the quality we are producing is fine, we don't need to adjust the optical sorter - if we are high on defects, we need to adjust the optical sorter. The number of times the optical sorter is checked / adjustes thus depends on the quality we are producing. I remain at your disposal should you require any further information.

Subject: BRF Claim - Protocolo 2902682
TextBody: Dear, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We have promptly registered it in our system under ticket number 00027274. We are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch. The quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter. Bath information: Lotcode : C06232812127 Production day : 8/10/2023 There is a complete Quality Assurance system in place and the principles of HACCP are applied. This includes a full monitoring system on the production line. The finished products themselves are sampled every 60 minutes and examined for quality, including length and slivers. Full records of these and all the other checks are maintained. Based on the lotcode, we have conducted a thorough investigation into our production records and quality documents for this specific batch. Please see below the results of the check at 21h05 Length >50mm: 65.43% (min 60% = standard) Length <25mm: 1.56% (max6% = standard) Although the values in our hourly checks do not suggest issues, the pictures indeed show very short fries. I have issues a credit note for these 2 boxes. We apologize for any inconvenience that you may have suffered. If you have any further concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us again.

Subject: BRF Claim - Protocolo 2929283
TextBody: Dear, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We have promptly registered it in our system under ticket number 00028083. We are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch. The quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter. Batch information: Lotcode : G10231351539 Production day : 15/05/2023 Based on the provided pictures we have received, we can confirm this is a piece of sprout on the potato. Sprout can occur while the potatoes are being stored. Potatoes with sprout are still good for consumption, but the sprout should be removed. It appears that, despite our best efforts, some foreign material may have escaped our monitoring systems. Based on the lotcode, we have conducted a thorough investigation into our production records and quality documents for the specific batch. No remarks were made during production. We are confident that this complaint is not widespread. We apologize for any inconvenience that you may have suffered. If you have any further concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us again.

Subject: BRF Claim - Protocolo 2912070
TextBody: Dear, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We have promptly registered it in our system under ticket number 00027273. We are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch. The quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter. Batch information: Lotcode : G11230512112 Production day : 20/02/2023 Given our production process, which includes stone washers, process water, blanchers, fryers, and more, it's highly unlikely that this insect could have traversed our entire production process without being detected and removed. We are confident that any contamination of this nature would have been identified at multiple points during production. Therefore, we suspect that the contamination may have occurred after the frying process. It's possible that an insect entered our production environment and became unintentionally attached to the fries before packaging. It’s important to note that we have a rigorous pest control system to prevent the entry of insects and rodents into the factory environment All doors are strictly required to remain closed at all times, and we consistently monitor and inspect these controls. Based on the picture, I cannot confirm this is indeed an insect. Would it be possible to send this foreign body for further analysis? Should you or your customer require additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Subject: BRF Claim - Protocolo 2922915
TextBody: Dear, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We have promptly registered it in our system under ticket number 00028084. We are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch. The quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter. Batch information: Lotcode : C04233390341 Packaging day : 5/12/2023 I would like to reassure you that during the packing process, we conduct quality checks. Our team tests the seals of the bags on an hourly basis. A box is removed from the packaging line, and all bags are meticulously inspected to ensure that the seals are properly closed. These inspection results are recorded in our Quality documents. In light of the concerns you raised, we have conducted an investigation into the packaging checks for the particular batch. No remarks were made. We regret any inconvenience this issue may have caused you or your customer. We take this matter seriously and are committed to preventing such incidents in the future. Should you require any further information or assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Subject: RE: quality issue - Battered skin on Fries 10 x10 mm
TextBody: Hi Moustafa, This claims has been registered in our system as follow up (ticket ID 00029339) The quality records gives a score of 10/10 on that particular time frame of the lot code of the picture. See enclosed the excel with the details. Yet, the tasting records says the batch was impact by bruises. Did the customer state it is more of a light blue color? When the product is fried, did the defects disappear? Concerning length, I don't see any remarks. Maybe there are some broken pieces due to transport? Subject: RE: 40313499 Morrisons FB Complaint - Roast Potatoes 800g 600477
TextBody: Hello Clare, I contacted the service engineer who is responsible for this project on the Tilburg line. Scope: improve overall quality of cut potatoes mainly by having fewer major and critical defects in sold product. Start: early 2024 and is a one-year project, therefore runs until the end of 2024. Status: The optical sorter (Vyrex) emits potatoes with defects. As it is now: a visual check is done to see if defects are within spec (at least 2x per hours). The settings of the optical sorter are adjusted after the visual check if it appears that there are too many defects. During a visual check, only a few bags are checked. So, there is a delay in amending the Vyrex settings. The aim of the software is to automatically make adjustments to the optical sorter, if adjustments are needed, the settings of the Vyrex will automatically be amended, as soon as the software detects too many defects. Which means: from the moment there pass too many potatoes with critical/major defects--> Vyrex will automatically be amended so more potatoes will be rejected, settings will be more tight. But if settings are too tight, too much good potatoes will also be rejected. So as soon as defects are again within spec, Vyrex will automatically be amended. The software settings are mapped per bulk reference, so the software can automatically adjust the optical sorter settings per bulk reference as efficiently as possible. Setting the software settings is done by the service engineer. The fine-tuning of the software cannot be done by the operators, but must be done by the service engineer. Which means fine tuning can not be done on every production, but when the service engineer is available to work on the project. As this is done not only for the roast potatoes, but for all our bulk references on that production line, it is a time consuming project with a long lead time. We are still collecting data to assess the project's effectiveness. Hope this info helps,

Subject: Complaint, battered spicy jacket potato 750 g
TextBody: Dear Aleksandra Štrbac , Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We have promptly registered it in our system under ticket number 00028963. We are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch. The quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter. Batch information: Lotcode : G3124035 Production day : 4/02/2024 Given our production process, which includes stone washers, process water, blanchers, fryers, and more, it's highly unlikely that this insect could have traversed our entire production process without being detected and removed. We are confident that any contamination of this nature would have been identified at multiple points during production. Therefore, we suspect that the contamination may have occurred after the frying process. It's possible that an insect entered our production environment and became unintentionally attached to the fries before packaging. It’s important to note that we have a rigorous pest control system to prevent the entry of insects and rodents into the factory environment All doors are strictly required to remain closed at all times, and we consistently monitor and inspect these controls I have already initiated the process of acquiring pest control information around the production date, 4/02/2024. As of now, our quality control results show nothing out of the ordinary. Unfortunately, it seems that despite our efforts, we failed to prevent contamination in this case, for which we wish to apologize. Should you or your customer require additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

TextBody: Hi Daniel, it comes back to the same explanation they have already given: "The method they use is a quick method for determining fat content, but a specific type of fat in our products is not included in the analysis. Hence the lower fat content. The Soxhlet method is the correct method to analyze our type of product."

Subject: Indemnités logistiques ITM - avril 2024 - 82006 - AGRISTO N-V - 76
TextBody: Sarah Detailleur Customer Experience Officer Agristo nv P +32 56 54 11 65 M + 0498 74 13 14 --------------- Forwarded Message --------------- From: ITMLAI_negociations_logistiques [itmlai_negociations_logistiques@mousquetaires.com] Sent: 31/05/2024 10:51 To: bram.tuytens@agristo.com; petra.vancompernolle@agristo.com; service@agristo.com; claims@agristo.com Subject: Indemnités logistiques ITM - avril 2024 - 82006 - AGRISTO N-V - 76 Madame, Monsieur, Nous avons trouvé un accord définissant les principes et les conditions logistiques et techniques qui s’appliquent entre nos deux sociétés. La loi n° 2023-221 du 30 mars 2023 poursuit les objectifs déjà présents dans la loi EGALIM 1 et 2. Cette loi, souvent désignée EGALIM 3, a été publiée au Journal officiel du 31 mars 2023. A ce titre, nous vous prions de trouver les datas indemnités logistiques retard et qualité de avril 2024, joints au présent courrier, lequel fait suite à nos différents échanges. Ce qui a pour objet de lancer la période d’échanges contradictoires en perspectives de trouver un accord sur le montant de réparation du préjudice. Nous vous rappelons que vous disposez d'un délai de 30 jours à compter de la réception de cet avis de pénalités pour en contrôler le bien-fondé et nous transmettre vos remarques. Merci de nous retourner vos analyses contradictoires associées à cette extraction. Au retour de vos remarques, lors d’échanges contradictoires, nous prendrons en compte les éléments justifiés et documentés que vous mentionneriez afin d’obtenir un accord avant établissement d’une facturation. Nous restons à votre disposition pour toute question et pour étudier avec vous des moyens spécifiques afin d'améliorer votre performance logistique pour nos prochaines commandes. Nous vous remercions de bien vouloir adresser vos retours à l'adresse mail : itmlai_negociations_logistiques@mousquetaires.com et à votre négociateur de dossier : - Fatyne BOUFOUS - fatyne.boufous@mousquetaires.com : Frais non laitier (volailles, œuf, traiteur, charcuterie, traiteur de la mer, viandes) - Priscillia LUZOLO - priscillia.luzolo@mousquetaires.com : DPH (Parfumerie, entretien et Hygiène) & Epicerie Salée - Marylise GOBIN - marylise.gobin@mousquetaires.com : Epicerie Sucrée / PPI & Animaux - Chloé MAYALA - chloe.mayala@mousquetaires.com : Vins & Champagnes, BNA, Bière, Alcools & Gel - Faustine BOSIO - faustine.bosio@mousquetaires.com : Frais Laitier - Carine GALLETTE - carine.gallette@mousquetaires.com : Maison/Textile Nous vous prions de croire, Madame, Monsieur, à l’expression de notre considération distinguée. Subject: 000200086208  - Incident sur le produit Frites 9 x
TextBody: Chère Isabelle Sieu , Nous vous remercions de nous avoir informé de ce sujet, que nous avons immédiatement enregistré dans notre système sous le numéro de ticket 00028994. Nous sommes désolés d'apprendre que votre client n'était pas satisfait de la qualité de cette série. La qualité de nos produits est d'une importance capitale pour nous, et nous sommes déterminés à résoudre cette question. Informations sur le batch: Lotcode : G012409704 Date de Production: 6/04/2024 Après avoir examiné la photo et la description, il semble que le corps étranger en question soit une grappe de graisse provenant du four. Nous tenons à vous assurer que nous effectuons une inspection visuelle régulière du four toutes les heures. Si nous constatons une accumulation excessive, notre équipe prend immédiatement des mesures pour nettoyer le four. En fonction du code de lot, nous avons réalisé une enquête sur les documents de production et de qualité, pour ce lot spécifique. Nous sommes convaincus que cette réclamation est un incident isolé et non répandu. Pour éviter de tels incidents, nous allons organiser des discussions avec notre équipe de production afin de renforcer leur attention lors de l'inspection visuelle du four. Nous nous excusons pour tout désagrément que vous avez pu subir. Si vous avez d'autres préoccupations, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter à nouveau. Cordialement, Sarah Sarah Detailleur Customer Experience Officer Agristo nv P +32 56 54 11 65 M + 0498 74 13 14 --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Agristo Claims [claims@agristo.com] Sent: 31/05/2024 11:40 To: isabelle.sieu@scamark.leclerc Subject: Agristo | Votre réclamation a été enregistrée (00028994) Cher client, Nous vous remercions de nous avoir informés du problème ci-dessous. Votre réclamation a été enregistrée dans notre système sous le numéro de ticket: 00028994. Afin d'assurer une communication efficace, veuillez répondre à cet e-mail pour toute communication ultérieure à ce sujet. Subject: RE: Agristo Service
TextBody: Dear All Good morning. Well noted. Thanks for your information and believe your service will be further better !!! We are glad. Noriko From: Pieter Lapierre <Pieter.Lapierre@agristo.com> Sent: Monday, June 3, 2024 7:08 PM To: Mya Thin Kyu (ミャ ティン チュー) <mya@kohyoj.co.jp>; Noriko Kataoka (片岡 範子) <kataoka@kohyoj.co.jp> Cc: Melissa Samyn <Melissa.Samyn@agristo.com>; Line Cabbeke <Line.Cabbeke@agristo.com>; Alexia Lacombe <Alexia.Lacombe@agristo.com> Subject: Agristo Service Dear Mya san, Noriko san, As already mentioned during our call some weeks ago, I want to inform you of an exciting development here at Agristo. Our Service team, currently consisting out of Technical Sales and Customer Service, is undergoing a transformative journey in the coming weeks and months, as we shift towards becoming a Customer Experience organization. This transformation is paired with some changes in customer allocation within both teams and in the way of communication. In concrete terms, for you, the following changes will take effect from today: * Personally, I will also become your point of contact, instead of Alexia, for everything related to orders, logistics and invoicing, next to the topics that I was already responsible for in my previous role as Technical Sales Officer (quality, packaging, specifications, …). * As from now on, you can direct all your service-related queries (so all questions and information which you used to send to Alexia and/or to myself) to the following central e-mail address: service@agristo.com<mailto:service@agristo.com>. This approach will centralize your questions and requests, allowing a more efficient and prompt processing. Of course, you can also still call or text me via WhatsApp. * As from now on, you can direct all your claims (so complaints related to packaging, quality and logistics) to the following central e-mail address: claims@agristo.com<mailto:claims@agristo.com>. Melissa and Line stay in place in their current roles and can be contacted as you are used to do. That being said: please note that I will not be in the office from tomorrow until end of next week. Marlies De Ketele will take over from me during this time – she already was my back-up for your account last summer. If you send your e-mails to service@agristo.com<mailto:service@agristo.com>, she will automatically receive your e-mail while I’m not in the office. As soon as I’m back, I will get your e-mails again. We understand that this represents a change for you, but we are confident that this new way of working will improve your overall experience with Agristo. If you have any questions or doubts, do not hesitate to contact me.

Subject: Stellungnahme Prüfbericht zu OP 2024/137234
TextBody: Dear, We have well received you below notification concerning our Harvest Basket Süsskartoffelpommes 500g. Declaration : Paprikaextract Our paprika oleoresin is categorized as an ‘flavouring preparation’ according EC 1334/2008 and is added to impart flavor. Net weight As part of the packaging process there are 2 check weighers on every packaging line. One which weighs every single bag and one which controls every filled carton (trade unit). When a bag or a carton weighs too little, either the bag or case will be rejected. Moreover, every shift the packaging operators checks the good functioning of the check weigher. Also the average weight of the bags is checked if conforming. All data from the packaging line (Garvens) is automatically registered. Attached you can find the automatic GarvensReport from the concerned production: Harvest Basket Süsskartoffelpommes 500g Agristo code : 312605 Lot: G24 23 314 11:44 Lot is referring to workcenter AW2 – Line 23 Packaging date: 9-11-2023 As you can see on the full report (attached), the average net weight has been reached during this production run = 500,2743g. We hope the above information has reassured you about the correct measures we follow. Please let me know you should have any further questions,

Subject: RE: quality issue - Battered skin on Fries 10 x10 mm
TextBody: Hi Tareq, We would like to see a picture of the product within the bag, so we can determine if it is indeed bruises. Some explanation about bruises. With this type of defect, the defect shows more of a blue/brown discoloration as a result of cell damage due f.e. transport With bruises we divide it into 2 categories based on the color intensity of the punch blue/brown. Severely bruises count as a normal defect Light bruises: count as minor defect. Using the color chart helps determine whether the bruises are counted as a regular defect or a minor. If the color is present on the color card, the defect is counted as a normal defect. If the color is not present on the color card, so the color intensity is lighter, the defect is counted as a minor defect. COLOR CHART: blue and brown shades [cid:image002.png@01DAB656.2B656940] [cid:image003.png@01DAB656.2B656940]

Subject: RE: 40313499 Morrisons FB Complaint - Roast Potatoes 800g 600477
TextBody: Evelien Mattheeuws Customer Service Officer UK & Europe P +32 56 54 10 68 --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Agristo Claims [claims@agristo.com] Sent: 3/06/2024 16:15 To: clare.rowlands@fullersfoods.com Cc: ciara.sauvage@fullersfoods.com; evelien.mattheeuws@agristo.com Subject: RE: Morrisons Roast Potatoes Hello Clare, I contacted the service engineer who is responsible for this project on the Tilburg line. Scope: improve overall quality of cut potatoes mainly by having fewer major and critical defects in sold product. Start: early 2024 and is a one-year project, therefore runs until the end of 2024. Status: The optical sorter (Vyrex) emits potatoes with defects. As it is now: a visual check is done to see if defects are within spec (at least 2x per hours). The settings of the optical sorter are adjusted after the visual check if it appears that there are too many defects. During a visual check, only a few bags are checked. So, there is a delay in amending the Vyrex settings. The aim of the software is to automatically make adjustments to the optical sorter, if adjustments are needed, the settings of the Vyrex will automatically be amended, as soon as the software detects too many defects. Which means: from the moment there pass too many potatoes with critical/major defects--> Vyrex will automatically be amended so more potatoes will be rejected, settings will be more tight. But if settings are too tight, too much good potatoes will also be rejected. So as soon as defects are again within spec, Vyrex will automatically be amended. The software settings are mapped per bulk reference, so the software can automatically adjust the optical sorter settings per bulk reference as efficiently as possible. Setting the software settings is done by the service engineer. The fine-tuning of the software cannot be done by the operators, but must be done by the service engineer. Which means fine tuning can not be done on every production, but when the service engineer is available to work on the project. As this is done not only for the roast potatoes, but for all our bulk references on that production line, it is a time consuming project with a long lead time. We are still collecting data to assess the project's effectiveness. Hope this info helps,

Subject: RE: [Ticket: 124753] Claim:503
TextBody: Hi Mya San, please see below my response: 1. The production operator, shift supervisor and process engineer are trained 'on the job'. But at the start of their career in Agristo, they do get a theoretical training per part of the production line, including the area after freezing where the last optical sorter is located. There is no manual. Per product there is a standard setting of the optical sorter. Based on the hourly QC results they can adjust sensitivity. Please see attached a document I set up with more information. I hope this is helpfull! 2. Our intermediate cleaning is only with water (pressure 30bar) when we do a product change. The deparment cleaning is responsible for the claning,and they are with 2-3 people. The verfication is done by the shift supervisor of the line. I hope this information helps your customer close done this case.

Subject: FW: Asda Crinkle Cut Chips - Nutrition Out of Spec
TextBody: Hi Dan, just for your info I want to share with you something we already shared on the NMR method 2 years ago: "Our experience over the last few years show the NMR method does not give a reliable result. It was always a method used commonly with milk powder which is a more homogeneous product but over the past few years appears to have been rolled out across other products such as our frozen potato products and is now commonly used in the UK. In fact we’ve had this exact same experience with another customer who was finding our products when tested weren’t in line with the nutrition in the spec/on pack. In this situation the results were as follows: - - Customer testing (NMR) = 4.9 - Spec/on pack claim = 9.7 - Same sample retested by customers lab but using Soxhlet method = 9.8 NB. For your interest I have attached a leaflet on NMR that does show results can come out lower but deemed to be not significant enough to worry about. Unfortunately we do not find this to be the case with our products. It also discusses how it is a preferred method as doesn’t require qualified staff and is a quicker method thus making it a much cheaper option, which explains a labs preference for using it." On potatoes: The variation depends on where we are in the season (early harvest, main harvest), as well as which potato variety is being used at that time. Since we work with natural products, it is not unusual to have natural variations in our products. Hopefully, the customer understands this as well. Of course, it is more meaningful to look at the overall picture and check the average from multiple analyses, rather than relying on just one analysis. Hope this helps!

Subject: TOYOTA COMPLAINT FOR FRY WITH SUBSTANCES LOOKS MOLD
TextBody: Dear Hagino, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We have promptly registered it in our system under ticket number 00029355. We are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch. The quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter. Batch information: Lotcode : A04233011124 Production day : 25/10/2023 By looking at the picture, we can confirm that this is some black fat coming from the baking oven. Apparently, some of the crum that can accumulate in the oven came loose and fell on a fry. Every hour the oven is visually checked. When there is too much fat accumulation, the oven is cleaned. It seems that this time, the oven was not cleaned on time and a clump of fat came loose. Normally these kind of clumps are removed by the optical sorter after freezing (before packing). It appears that, despite our best efforts, some foreign material may have escaped our monitoring system. Based on the batch code, we traced back the production day of this product to the 25th of October 2023. I have checked our records and there were no anomalies registered from this nature. Our hourly quality checks also do not mention any comment in this regard. We also haven’t received any similar complaints. That is why we think this is an isolated incident, for which we would like to apologize. I have escalated this complaint to our production team, so they pay more attention to the visual check of the oven. Please do not hesitate to contact me in case of further questions.

Subject: R32074 - 262853
TextBody: Bonjour, Nous avons bien reçu votre e-mail et l'avons enregistré sous le numéro de dossier 00029451. Nous regrettons que votre client ne soit pas satisfait de ce produit. Nous n'avons reçu aucune autre plainte à ce sujet. Les rapports de qualité horaires ne mentionnaient pas non plus de frites foncées. Après que les pommes de terre sont coupées en frites, elles sont brièvement blanchies, puis séchées, et pré-frites pendant environ 30 secondes à 180°C. Ces frites foncées ont probablement exceptionnellement passé le filtre du four de cuisson et ont été embarquées dans le four. L'huile dans le four de cuisson est continuellement filtrée, et sur la base des rapports du four de cuisson et des rapports de qualité horaires, nous sommes convaincus qu'il s'agit d'un incident isolé. Les frites foncées ne doivent pas être consommées, mais jetées à la poubelle. À l'exception de ces frites foncées, la qualité du produit est parfaitement en ordre et le produit peut être consommé. Nous dédommageons votre client pour le désagrément en émettant une note de crédit pour ce sac. Cordialement, Regine --------------- Original Message --------------- From: MONTAGNER Maurine [m.montagner@passionfroid.fr] Sent: 4/06/2024 09:04 To: Regine.Legein@agristo.com Subject: R32074 - 262853 Bonjour, Suite à une réclamation un client nous informe une anomalie sur la référence 26893 Frite bi temp 9/9 (2,5KGx4) /10KG PPF En effet, le client nous informe d’une quantité importante de frites de couleur foncée. La traçabilité incriminée est : DLC : 07/03/2026 LOT : DC 0524 070 Avez-vous eu d’autres réclamations ? Quelles sont les causes de cette anomalie ? Quelles actions allez-vous mettre en place ? Notre client demande donc un avoir sur 1 colis. Nous attendons votre retour sous 48h afin d’apporter une réponse au client. Bonne journée, Cordialement, ______________________________________________ Maurine MONTAGNER Service Qualité & RSE Passion Froid Est 12, rue du bois Jacquot - 54670 - Millery m.montagner@passionfroid.fr www.passionfroid.fr

TextBody: Goedemiddag Regine, Gisteren zijn hier geen speciale dingen gebeurd. Als ik kijk naar de laadtijd van deze vracht was deze binnen de tijd geladen geen lange wachttijden omwille van breuken of iets dergelijks. Als ik naar de foto’s kijk van de pallets, dan zie ik ook een echt heel erg scheve pallet staan. Zulke pallets laden wij hier niet. Pallets die zo scheef staan, die gaan wij ook niet laden. Onze vraag van hieruit is of de chauffeur wel zijn frigo heeft aangelegd. [cid:image009.png@01DAB754.88F2CB80] Hier het ovezicht van hoelang het geduurd heeft om deze vracht te laden. Temperaturen worden met een thermometer (bij deze vracht -20) genomen en genoteerd in TMS zoals hieronder zichtbaar. Subject: LITIGE FACTURATION- AGRISTO- TRANSPORT NON DU-  CAUSE RUPTURE FOURNISSEUR
TextBody: Bonjour Zoë, Merci pour cette explication, en revanche je ne suis pas d’accord pour que nous payions plus cher alors que les modification de cette commande sont de votre fait : il aurait été convenable de ne pas nous faire supporter le cout de votre rupture et de ce problème technique dans votre entrepôt et de nous appliquer le prix habituel pour 32 palettes à 1715.70€ ( même s’il n’y en avait que 26) 1. Notre commande initiale comportait 32 palettes ( tarif transport 1715.70€) vous nous demandez une modification de commande ( mail en pj) due à votre rupture, nous sommes obligés de descendre à 29 palettes. 2. Votre grue garde en otage 3 de nos palettes ce qui fait descendre cette commande non optimisée à 26 palettes, mais vous faites quand même partir. J’aimerai vous demander une facturation du transport comme à l’habitude soit 1715.70€ comme si vous aviez pu honorer notre commande. Normalement. Je vous remercie pour votre retour Zoë sur ce dossier afin de libérer la facture. Bien cordialement,

Subject: Packaging sealing issue - Farmchef Rosti Hashbrown
TextBody: Hello Rachel, Kathleen is currently enjoying some time off, but I wish to get back to you on the below. Thank you for sharing this information, based on the pictures we have received we could link the following production: - Lot : D07 24 075 1215 - Packaging day : 15th March 2024 - Packaging order: 2128600 Having looked at the picture we indeed see the traversal seal has not been sealed properly. We unfortunately know the problem. The sealing of the bags is effectuated by heat. This means it is very imporatnt that the correct temperature is being used to seal the bags. Too high temperature would mean that the bags would meld, too low temperature means that the bags aren't sealed enough. Our production engineers have been working on this and did write an improved instruction, in order to have the most optimal temperature for sealing, taking into account the thickness and density of the foil. Also during production, every hour the operatores have to check the seal of the bags. A bag is taken from the line and is checked if seals are properly closed. Registrations of these checks are noted in QC documents. Having checked this particular run, I could not see any irregularties noted. Given the speed of our packaging lines, it must have occured that some bags escaped our monitoring system, for which we wish to apologize. We noted you currently had a complaint about 5 bags. Please be sure to keep us informed if any furhter complatins would be reported. At your disposal for further questions, Michèle Vandenbroucke Technical Sales Agristo nv P +32 56 54 09 44 --------------- Original Message --------------- From: rachel low [rachellow@benfoods.com] Sent: 3/06/2024 11:08 To: Kathleen.Samyn@agristo.com Cc: Beau.Declerck@agristo.com; paulfoo@benfoods.com Subject: Packaging sealing issue - Farmchef Rosti Hashbrown External: Verify the sender before clicking any link/attachment. Hi Kathleen We received notice from 1 of our retailers that the packaging for Farmchef Rosti Hashbrown are not sealed properly again. This is not the first incident, as we have faced this issue before with the sealing. The outlet reported 5 affected packs, and will do a check across for any other occurrence. We do not have the date/batch print info on the carton as it has been discarded. But please refer to the product image attached for the time stamp. Thanks! Thank you &

Subject: [Request for confirmation] Claim Report 392084 　[597:Agristo(ヘ゛ルキ゛ー)]
TextBody: Hi, we have well received the metal wire and tested it on our metal detector. It was rejected 9/12 times. After thoroughly reviewing the piece, we don't believe the piece is origined from our production site. We don't see any product residue on the FB There were not metal icidents during this run This is a magnetic metal piece, so we suspect this is iron. All our machinery is stainless steel and thus non magnetic. We believe the likelihood of this small piece coming from the field into our process and travelling all the way through to your bag is very low. Can this come from the equipement at the consumer's home, such as the fryer?

Subject: Foreign body complaint REF: 27446474
TextBody: Dear, We have well received your below notification about the presence of a piece of blue plastic in the hash browns. Based on the lotcode we have received, the following batch is concerned: Lot : D08 24 128 Order: 1302132767 Packed: 6th and 7th of May After reviewing the complaint pictures, we believe this seems to match the bristles of the brush in the peeling lines. These are small, soft, plastic threads, in blue colour. On the 7th May, during their quality check round, QC has been logged a damaged brush near the peeling line 2 around 17h. Peeling line 2 was used for the production of the Hash Browns on 6th May from 5h20 to 22h24, 1 day before the brush incident. Afterwards peeling line 1 has been used for further production on 7th May. During the production on May 6th, QC conducted three quality checks, none of which reported irregularities near the peeling line. There are multiple steps after the peeling line to remove foreign objects (such as salt bath, metal detection, optical sorters, cutting knives, etc.), and since no ejections were reported in the packaging department, no product was blocked due to the damaged brush. To date, we have not received any similar complaints from that period. Based on our investigation and our rigorous quality controls, we believe this to be an isolated incident. Given that the foreign object is blue and easily noticeable, and is soft and incapable of causing injuries, we confirm there is no food safety risk. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. If you have any further concerns or questions, please do not hesitate to contact us. Michèle Vandenbroucke Technical Sales Agristo nv P +32 56 54 09 44 --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Supplier complaint responses [supplierresponses@brake.co.uk] Sent: 3/06/2024 18:26 To: claims@agristo.com Cc: supplierresponses@brake.co.uk; ivonne.goetsch@sysco.com Subject: Foreign body complaint REF: 27446474 Good afternoon, REFERENCE NUMBER: 27446474 We have received the following foreign body complaint and request an investigation is carried out so that we can communicate the results back to our customer. Please investigate and respond with your report via email to: Supplierresponses@brake.co.uk covering the questions below within 5 working days of the date of this Email. Date Complaint recorded 03/06/2024 Product Maestro Hash Browns Triangle 1x2.5kg Brakes Product code 136961 Best before or use by date 06/05/2025 Or 06/05/2026 (picture is not clear) Batch Code D08 24 128 14:51 Customer Complaint Details Customer has found plastic in hash browns Please note that the response must include, as a minimum, the following points :- 1. Possible sources of contamination. 2. Precautions taken to prevent contamination/ensure detection. 3. Where a batch/date code is provided, and where relevant to the foreign body described, were your foreign body prevention/detection systems working correctly on the production day in question. 4. If from the description of the complaint you believe the item may have originated from your site, please confirm any action taken as a result. 5. Confirm whether any similar complaints have been received from any of your customer base. If so, what actions you have taken as a result. Please quote the above reference number in any correspondence and reply by email to: Supplierresponses@brake.co.uk

Subject: CMPL0047441 - Klacht - ART 22160 BONI aardappelkroketten oven 1kg
TextBody: Dag Veerle, Dank u wel voor de regeling vorige week om de stukjes terug bij ons te krijgen. Hopelijk kunnen we ook nog de deeltjes bemachtigen van de tweede klacht die nu bij het FAVV ligt. Hebben jullie al bericht gekregen van de instantie? In tussentijd is er al onderzoek gedaan naar de deeltjes die we in ons bezit hebben. Dit zijn de details van het onderzoek: Deeltje ontvangen van 1 klacht op 11/06 (opgestuurd door Colruyt Haacht) Bevindingen bij onderzoek van de deeltjes: • Geen witte achterkant: vermoedelijk dus niet van premix/grondstof. • kleur is lichter dan het blauw van de transportband. • deeltjes zijn minder hard dan de plastiek van de blauwe schoppen Kleur is gelijkend op die van blauwe handschoenen. Hoewel de deeltjes zeer klein zijn (max 2mm) lijken ze ook ietwat elastisch. Momenteel kunnen we niet vastleggen hoe een handschoen in dergelijk kleine deeltjes zou kunnen ‘versnipperd’ worden in ons productieproces. Bovendien werden er geen deeltjes IN de puree maar aan de buitenkant van de puree, ter hoogte van de korst, teruggevonden. Voorlopig kunnen we er dus nog niet de vinger op leggen waarvan de deeltjes afkomstig zijn. We weten nog niet zeker of er een verband is tussen de twee klachten, daar het andere deeltje vermoedelijk nog bij het FAVV zit. Ik heb al de details van onze onderzoeken in een document gegoten als overzicht voor u. Had u graag nog een meeting gehad met ons om het onderzoek nog eens te overlopen? Met vriendelijke groeten Sandrine Van Bockstael Technical Sales Officer Agristo nv P +32 498 60 12 06 --------------- Original Message ---------------

Subject: R32074 - 262853
TextBody: Bonjour, En annexe vous trouverez la note de crédit correspondant à cette plainte. Cordialement, Zoë Zoë Feys Customer Service Agristo nv P +32 56 54 11 67 --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Agristo Claims [claims@agristo.com] Sent: 5/06/2024 11:31 To: m.montagner@passionfroid.fr Cc: Regine.Legein@agristo.com Subject: RE: R32074 - 262853 Bonjour, Nous avons bien reçu votre e-mail et l'avons enregistré sous le numéro de dossier 00029451. Nous regrettons que votre client ne soit pas satisfait de ce produit. Nous n'avons reçu aucune autre plainte à ce sujet. Les rapports de qualité horaires ne mentionnaient pas non plus de frites foncées. Après que les pommes de terre sont coupées en frites, elles sont brièvement blanchies, puis séchées, et pré-frites pendant environ 30 secondes à 180°C. Ces frites foncées ont probablement exceptionnellement passé le filtre du four de cuisson et ont été embarquées dans le four. L'huile dans le four de cuisson est continuellement filtrée, et sur la base des rapports du four de cuisson et des rapports de qualité horaires, nous sommes convaincus qu'il s'agit d'un incident isolé. Les frites foncées ne doivent pas être consommées, mais jetées à la poubelle. À l'exception de ces frites foncées, la qualité du produit est parfaitement en ordre et le produit peut être consommé. Nous dédommageons votre client pour le désagrément en émettant une note de crédit pour ce sac. Cordialement, Regine --------------- Original Message --------------- From: MONTAGNER Maurine [m.montagner@passionfroid.fr] Sent: 4/06/2024 09:04 To: Regine.Legein@agristo.com Subject: R32074 - 262853 Bonjour, Suite à une réclamation un client nous informe une anomalie sur la référence 26893 Frite bi temp 9/9 (2,5KGx4) /10KG PPF En effet, le client nous informe d’une quantité importante de frites de couleur foncée. La traçabilité incriminée est : DLC : 07/03/2026 LOT : DC 0524 070 Avez-vous eu d’autres réclamations ? Quelles sont les causes de cette anomalie ? Quelles actions allez-vous mettre en place ? Notre client demande donc un avoir sur 1 colis. Nous attendons votre retour sous 48h afin d’apporter une réponse au client. Bonne journée, Cordialement, ______________________________________________ Maurine MONTAGNER Service Qualité & RSE Passion Froid Est 12, rue du bois Jacquot - 54670 - Millery m.montagner@passionfroid.fr www.passionfroid.fr

Subject: Referenz #GeVo2003589025: PRIO-1 Complaint plastic, Issue: 2003588396, [GUT&GÜNSTIG, 27.4.2026, D07 24 119 14:58]
TextBody: EDEKA Kunden- und Ernährungsservice GUT&GÜNSTIG Backofen-Rösti-Ecken Issue Number: 2003588396 URGENT! Dear sir or madam we received the following customer’s complaint through our customer service. We expect you to review the incident immediately and send a first detailed statement within two hours after receiving this mail. Please see below for the reason for complaint and product details. Product: GTIN: 4311501057445 Article: Backofen-Rösti-Ecken Brand: GUT&GÜNSTIG BBD: 27.4.2026 Lot: D07 24 119 14:58 Issue: original text: Guten Tag, beim Essen der G&G Backofen Rösti-Ecken habe ich auf ein nicht identifizierbares festes, scharfkantiges Stück gebissen, was sehr weh getan hat. Ein kleines Stück, was davon abgebrochen ist, habe ich leider verschluckt. Im Anhang erhalten Sie Bilder vom besagten Stück (auch mit Größenvergleich) und die Verpackung der Rösti-Ecken. Hello, Whilst eating the G&G oven rosti wedges, I bit on an unidentifiable, firm, sharp-edged piece, which really hurt. Unfortunately, I swallowed a small piece that broke off. Please find attached pictures of the piece in question (also with size comparison) and the packaging of the rösti wedges. ________________________________ We expect a detailed and comprehensive statement regarding this complaint. Please carry out a thorough investigation and provide us the result of the investigation within the a.m. timeframe. Please include answers to the following questions as well: 1. When was the production of this product? 2. Did you notice any entry of plastic foreign bodies in the relevant production period? 3. Did you receive other complaints about this product? 4. What preventive measures against the entry foreign bodies exist in the production facility? 5. 5. Do you keep records of plastic and glass materials or objects in your production facility? 6. What is the possibility of the introduction of plastic foreign bodies through raw or packaging materials? 7. Are the production lines covered entirely? 8. Are staff trained in terms of glass breakage? 9. Are there any contract workers employed in your production facility? 10. Were there any service workers or engineers working during production? Please send us an excerpt of your HACCP concept regarding plastic and glass policy and your current IFS-certificate. Please let us know what quantities of the relevant production lot have been shipped and to which warehouses. When were the goods delivered? Were any further goods delivered after this particular batch/lot (when, and in what quantities)? Please send your statement solely by email, maintaining the original subject to reklamation@edeka.de<mailto:reklamation@edeka.de> and the whole mailing list of this email. If you are missing any product details, please let us know. Nevertheless we ask you to answer all questions where possible. Please send us the missing details once you received the missing product details. Thanks! Should you have further documents or information available that might help resolving the complaint, please add these as well. Should you require any further information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Subject: FW: Video from Rishad Abdulkader
TextBody: Beste Randa, wij hebben deze mail goed ontvangen en geregistreerd als case n° 00029985. Lot: C03 24 076 15:15 Prod: 16/03/2024 Exp: 15/09/2025 bakorder 1038021 batch 1202128992. Dit product werd geproduceerd in Tilburg, Nederland. Zoals jullie weten voeren wij kwaliteitscontroles uit. Elk uur wordt een zak van de lijn gehaald en wordt die op verschillende kwaliteitsparameters getest. Voor deze lotcode heb ik de rapporten van de 2 omliggende uurcontroles gecontroleerd (15:55 en 15:03). De enige opmerking die er gemaakt wordt, is dat het aantal kortere frieten aan de hoge kant is, maar wel nog steeds binnen specificatie. Voor de rest zit de droge stof goed, defects zitten ruim onder de maximum waardes, met uitzondering van een halve critical defect (dus eentje op 2kg). Ik merk wel dat er voor die uurcodes niet werd afgebakken, dus ik vraag de kwaliteitsafdeling in Tilburg om een retentiestaal af te bakken. Ik kom hier zo snel mogelijk op terug. Met vriendelijke groeten, Regine --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Randa Jansen [randa.jansen@mondialfoods.nl] Sent: 5/06/2024 16:45 To: Regine.Legein@agristo.com Cc: richard.kettering@mondialfoods.nl; richard.aaltink@mondialfoods.nl Subject: FW: Video from Rishad Abdulkader Beste Regine, Ik kreeg onderstaande binnen van mijn collega Richard Kettering. Zouden jullie hier in kunnen duiken? ​​​​​​ ​

Subject: Referenz #GeVo2003589025: PRIO-1 Complaint plastic, Issue: 2003588396, [GUT&GÜNSTIG, 27.4.2026, D07 24 119 14:58]
TextBody: EDEKA Kunden- und Ernährungsservice GUT&GÜNSTIG Backofen-Rösti-Ecken Issue Number: 2003588396 URGENT! Dear sir or madam we received the following customer’s complaint through our customer service. We expect you to review the incident immediately and send a first detailed statement within two hours after receiving this mail. Please see below for the reason for complaint and product details. Product: GTIN: 4311501057445 Article: Backofen-Rösti-Ecken Brand: GUT&GÜNSTIG BBD: 27.4.2026 Lot: D07 24 119 14:58 Issue: original text: Guten Tag, beim Essen der G&G Backofen Rösti-Ecken habe ich auf ein nicht identifizierbares festes, scharfkantiges Stück gebissen, was sehr weh getan hat. Ein kleines Stück, was davon abgebrochen ist, habe ich leider verschluckt. Im Anhang erhalten Sie Bilder vom besagten Stück (auch mit Größenvergleich) und die Verpackung der Rösti-Ecken. Hello, Whilst eating the G&G oven rosti wedges, I bit on an unidentifiable, firm, sharp-edged piece, which really hurt. Unfortunately, I swallowed a small piece that broke off. Please find attached pictures of the piece in question (also with size comparison) and the packaging of the rösti wedges. ________________________________ We expect a detailed and comprehensive statement regarding this complaint. Please carry out a thorough investigation and provide us the result of the investigation within the a.m. timeframe. Please include answers to the following questions as well: 1. When was the production of this product? 2. Did you notice any entry of plastic foreign bodies in the relevant production period? 3. Did you receive other complaints about this product? 4. What preventive measures against the entry foreign bodies exist in the production facility? 5. 5. Do you keep records of plastic and glass materials or objects in your production facility? 6. What is the possibility of the introduction of plastic foreign bodies through raw or packaging materials? 7. Are the production lines covered entirely? 8. Are staff trained in terms of glass breakage? 9. Are there any contract workers employed in your production facility? 10. Were there any service workers or engineers working during production? Please send us an excerpt of your HACCP concept regarding plastic and glass policy and your current IFS-certificate. Please let us know what quantities of the relevant production lot have been shipped and to which warehouses. When were the goods delivered? Were any further goods delivered after this particular batch/lot (when, and in what quantities)? Please send your statement solely by email, maintaining the original subject to reklamation@edeka.de <mailto:reklamation@edeka.de> and the whole mailing list of this email. If you are missing any product details, please let us know. Nevertheless we ask you to answer all questions where possible. Please send us the missing details once you received the missing product details. Thanks! Should you have further documents or information available that might help resolving the complaint, please add these as well. Should you require any further information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Subject: FW: JPB 9/9 D23-03379 oude friet geladen
TextBody: Dear customer, Thank you for informing us about the below issue. Your complaint was registered in our system as ticket: 00029996. To ensure efficient communication, kindly use this email thread for further correspondence regarding this matter.

Subject: Referenz #GeVo2003589025: PRIO-1 Complaint plastic, Issue: 2003588396, [GUT&GÜNSTIG, 27.4.2026, D07 24 119 14:58]
TextBody: Dear Reklamation, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We have promptly registered it in our system under ticket number 00029982. We are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch. The quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter. Batch information: Lotcode : D07241191458 Packaging day : 28/04/2024 The production process includes numerous physical and optical elimination steps to detect and remove foreign objects. Agristo continuously strives to invest in the latest best practice technical solutions to prevent foreign object contamination. Initially, the potatoes go through a stone remover, which operates based on centrifugal forces and effectively eliminates any objects heavier than potatoes. Following the stone remover, there is a water bath to remove floating particles, and a hedgehog conveyor that eliminates leafage. The leafage adheres to the pins that extend from the conveyor and is subsequently removed. After peeling and washing, the potatoes undergo optical sorting to eliminate foreign objects. Using a color camera, a mechanical system rejects foreign bodies, green potatoes, and potatoes with severe defects and diseases. The potatoes are then transported to the production line, where they are cut and inspected for black parts by a second optical sorter, and any defects are rejected using compressed air. Additionally, small dark-colored foreign bodies are detected and rejected. These initial steps are designed to effectively remove foreign bodies from the potatoes. Unfortunately, it appears that in this instance, a foreign body has managed to evade these steps. However, based on the provided picture and description, we are unable to determine the root cause of this issue. Could you please send this foreign object to the address provided below for further investigation? Agristo nv (for Ines Aerts) Venecoweg 12 9810 Nazareth We have checked our quality records for this run and we noticed nothing in particular for now. We do apologize for any inconvenience that you may have suffered. If you have any further concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us again.

Subject: Ref: 324042TH Customer Enquiry
TextBody: Dear Terek Hazell, Thank you for delivering us some more detailed information about this complaint. Based on this specific lotcode we were able to determin the exact production date, 10/05/2023. Furthermore, we were also able to do a more profound investigation based on the specific lotcode regarding production timing. I have checked the QC results around the hour of packing (14u16). We had an hourly check at 14:38; 15:14. I have checked the tasting information as well as the hourly analysis. There were no foreign bodies found and there were no remarks made regarding fat clumps or problems with the oven. We hope with this extra investigation we have reassured you that this would be an isolated case.

Subject: Klacht inzake BK - DV - Ovenfrites - zak 1kg (leverancier 2023) -  (Kenmerk: 202405792-06) #ID-KNzkEsOK
TextBody: Beste, Wij mochten onderstaande consumentenklacht met betrekking tot de textuur van de G'woon ovenfriet 1000g in goede orde ontvangen. Het spijt ons te vernemen dat uw consument een negatieve ervaring had met een door Agristo geproduceerd artikel. Wij hechten immers het grootste belang aan de kwaliteit van onze producten en verpakkingen. Wij hebben deze melding in ons systeem geregistreerd onder ticket 29987. Aan de hand van de lotcode (B01240441219 ) en de vervaldatum (12/02/2026) hebben wij kunnen achterhalen dat dit een productie betreft van 13/02/2024. We hebben de productiebladen en de kwaliteitscontroles van deze batch gecontroleerd – er werden geen anomalieën genoteerd. De volledige productie was conform. De tijden die op de verpakking staat zijn gevalideerd in gekalibreerde oven door onze kwaliteitsdienst. Elke oven is verschillend en kan afwijken van temperatuur. Hierdoor is het mogelijk dat het product langer in de oven moet. Wij hebben geen eerdere klachten hieromtrent ontvangen en gaan ervanuit dat dit een geïsoleerd geval is. Alvast bedankt om ons hiervan op de hoogte te brengen. Met vriendelijke groeten, Evelien Cremers Evelien Technical Sales Officer Agristo nv P +32 56 54 09 44 --------------- Original Message ---------------

Subject: Bofrost* Fremdteil in BIO Kartoffel wedges
TextBody: Sehr geehrte Herr Leuchten, Wir haben die folgende Verbraucherbeschwerde über einen Fremdkörper in den Bofrost BIO Katoffelkeilen in gutem Zustand erhalten. Es tut uns leid zu erfahren, dass Ihr Verbraucher eine negative Erfahrung mit einem von Agristo hergestellten Artikel gemacht hat. Schließlich legen wir größten Wert auf die Qualität unserer Produkte und Verpackungen. Wir haben diese Meldung in unserem System unter dem Ticket 27709 registriert. Anhand des Chargencodes (A04 23 270 2145 ) und des Verfallsdatums (26.09.2025) konnten wir herausfinden, dass es sich um eine Produktion vom 27.09.2023 handelt. Wir überprüften die Produktionsblätter und Qualitätskontrollen dieser Charge - es wurden keine Anomalien festgestellt. Die gesamte Produktion war vorschriftsmäßig. Bevor die Kartoffeln als Keile in Beutel verpackt werden, durchlaufen sie einen umfangreichen Prozess, um Fremdkörper zu erkennen: Der Produktionsprozess umfasst viele physische und optische Schritte zur Eliminierung von Fremdkörpern. Agristo versucht auch, in alle neuen technischen Lösungen zur Vermeidung von Fremdkörpern zu investieren. Wenn die Kartoffeln in unseren Betrieb kommen, wird das Metall zunächst mit einem Magneten entfernt. Dann durchlaufen die Kartoffeln einen Steinlöser. Der Steinentferner arbeitet mit Zentrifugalkräften und entfernt alle Gegenstände, die schwerer sind als Kartoffeln. Nach dem Steinentferner durchlaufen sie ein Wasserbad, um alle schwimmenden Teile zu entfernen, und ein Igelband, um das Laub zu entfernen. Das Laub bleibt an den aus dem Band kommenden Stiften hängen und wird auf diese Weise entfernt. Nachdem die Kartoffeln geschält und gewaschen wurden, durchlaufen sie einen optischen Sortierer, um Fremdkörper zu entfernen. Durch eine Farbkamera werden Fremdkörper, grüne Kartoffeln und Kartoffeln mit schweren Mängeln und Krankheiten durch ein mechanisches System aussortiert. Die Kartoffeln werden dann in die Produktionslinie gepumpt, wo sie geschnitten und von einem zweiten optischen Sortierer auf schwarze Teile überprüft werden - die Fehler werden mit Druckluft entfernt. Kleine dunkel gefärbte Fremdkörper werden ebenfalls erkannt und aussortiert. Wir haben den Fremdkörper erhalten und ihn mit unserem Metalldetektor getestet (siehe Anhang). Das Stück ist eher ein sehr kleiner Stein, weshalb es vom Metalldetektor nicht ausgeworfen wird. Außerdem gehen wir davon aus, dass dieses Stück, da es sich in der Tasche befand, durch einen der verschiedenen Eliminierungsschritte entfernt werden wird. Wir vermuten daher, dass das Stück nicht von uns stammt. Mit freundlichen Grüßen, Evelien Cremers Evelien Technical Sales Officer Agristo nv P +32 56 54 09 44 --------------- Original Message --------------- From: No-reply [noreply.salesforce@agristo.com] Sent: 27/05/2024 15:40 To: jeroen.perseyn@agristo.com; joke.vansteenkiste@agristo.com Subject: Further investigation requested for complaint 00027709 Dear, Further investigation was requested for complaint 00027709. Below you find relevant information of complaint. An investigator needs to be appointed. Overview Complaint: - Company name: BOFROST DIENSTLEISTUNGS GmbH & Co K - Reason for complaint: Foreign body -- Details for complaint: Metal -- Customer description: - Responsible party: Harelbeke (P010) - AH1 Request from CX: Deeltje metaal is ontvangen en zal met interne post naar jullie toekomen. Kunnen jullie kijken of dit wordt uitgestoten door onze metaal detectie. CX Owner: Evelien Cremers Link to complaint: 00027709 Thanks for taking up this further investigation.

TextBody: Dear Marlies Good afternoon. If I am not mistaken I haven’t received the answer from you yet. Due to this 1 carton which we don’t know what it is, the Japan customs has suspend the import procedure of the container and Toyota is facing a problem. Can you please check and inform me what the product is ? Shoestring or Natural cut or something ? According to your answerer we are also required to modify current documents. I am sorry to ask you this request but it would be highly appreciated if you could come bac to me today, Thank you very much for your cooperation ! Hagino From: Hagino - Japan Office <ax1@mopera.net> Sent: Thursday, June 6, 2024 1:00 AM To: 'Agristo Service' <service@agristo.com> Subject: FW: TOYOTA REQUEST FOR CHECK ON 1CT NOT FOR TOYOTA WAS MIXED IN A CONTAINER Importance: High Dear Marlies I sent you following mail. I forgot to inform you important thing in my mail and I am sorry. But the customs suspend their customs clearance procedure of the whole container until we answer them what is 1 CT. So Is this possible to check and come back to me please ? Thank you very much for your help in advance. Hagino From: Hagino - Japan Office <ax1@mopera.net<mailto:ax1@mopera.net>> Sent: Wednesday, June 5, 2024 7:10 PM To: 'Agristo Service' <service@agristo.com<mailto:service@agristo.com>> Subject: TOYOTA REQUEST FOR CHECK ON 1CT NOT FOR TOYOTA WAS MIXED IN A CONTAINER Dear Marlies, In the following container there is 1CT which is not for Toyota was mixed in a pallet. Please have a look at attached photo. 5A/24 Destination Tokyo IV# 90593090 BL#MEDUAX570347 C/N#MEDU9094940 Toyota must to report to the customs what is this and destroy. Can you please advise what is the product ( shoestring / natural ) and destination where it should gone but actually came to Japan ? Thank you very much Hagino

Subject: Agristo / Cial / Technical claim: bags without inkjet
TextBody: Hi Eileen, About the corrective actions; According to HACCP principles, the inkjet on the bag is checked at the start of each run and then every hour. These hourly checks cover what is produced in between as when a stamp is okay at 23h00 and at 00h00, there is no reason or possibility for a missing stamp between those hours. As all checks turned out okay during this run, we suspect that the bags with missing code should be from the end of the run. We will keep performing these checks as usual and will keep an extra eye open during the next production runs of this product.

Subject: Ref: 324042TH Customer Enquiry
TextBody: Good Afternoon I have today received the mentioned foreign object and I will forward this to you in today’s post. Thanks Terek Terek Hazell Farmfoods Limited Office: 0121 700 7160 From: Agristo Claims <claims@agristo.com> Sent: Thursday, June 6, 2024 12:47 PM To: Terek Hazell <thazell@farmfoods.co.uk> Cc: samanthamyrie87@live.com Subject: RE: Ref: 324042TH Customer Enquiry Dear Terek Hazell, Thank you for delivering us some more detailed information about this complaint. Based on this specific lotcode we were able to determin the exact production date, 10/05/2023. Furthermore, we were also able to do a more profound investigation based on the specific lotcode regarding production timing. I have checked the QC results around the hour of packing (14u16). We had an hourly check at 14:38; 15:14. I have checked the tasting information as well as the hourly analysis. There were no foreign bodies found and there were no remarks made regarding fat clumps or problems with the oven. We hope with this extra investigation we have reassured you that this would be an isolated case.

Subject: PPF OUEST:  URGENT - Anomalie produits - AGRISTO
TextBody: Bonjour, J'ai demandé des informations sur cet envoi au service expédition. Ce chargement a été effectué à Agristo Wielsbeke le mardi 4 juin 2024. Aucun commentaire n'a été noté ce jour-là. Le camion a été chargé dans les temps (début du chargement 16h48 – fin du chargement 17h16) . Nous effectuons également un contrôle de température avec un thermomètre sur un pallet aléatoire par chargement, et cette valeur est enregistrée dans notre système de gestion du transport. Pour ce chargement, une valeur de -20°C a été notée. Veuillez trouver ci-dessous les rapports de chargement. Sur les photos que vous nous avez envoyées, nous constatons que les palettes sont empilées de manière très oblique. Les palettes ne sont pas chargées de cette manière chez nous. Nous nous demandons comment ces palettes sont arrivées dans cet état chez vous et si le chauffeur du camion a bien mis en marche la réfrigération. Cordialement, Regine
